characters: THE FIRST DROP OF TAMARA'S BLOOD TOUCHES THE SACRIFICIAL
CROWN PIERCING THE WOMAN'S FOREHEAD, HER SCREAMS ECHOES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blonde-haired, armored AESIR RAIDER withdraws the blood sword from the stomach of ISLENE, a wild-maned Cimmerian beauty, many months pregnant, now clutching her bloody stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across a muddy battlefield, the air a maelstrom of fallin snowflakes and embers from trees aflame, the powerfully b CORIN rallies his fellow CIMMERIANS, until he spots Islen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Islene!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wielding a broadsword, runes etched into its surface, Cor cuts a bloody path through his enemies, his eyes never leaving Islene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aesir standing over Islene LAUGHS as she claws at the earth behind her, trying to pull herself away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, now little whore. Did I get you or your little one? 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Islene's hand reaches back once again -- and it finds a fallen warrior's SWORD. In one fluid motion she swings th sword around her body and drives it into the gap in the Aesir's armor -- at his groin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd ask you the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aesir HOWLS in agony, raising his sword to deliver th killing blow -- when another sword pierces his chest. The Aesir falls, revealing Corin standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin throws aside his horned helmet, and falls to his kn beside Islene, checking her wound. When he pulls his hand back they are coated in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes meet. Torment. Loss. They both know. She pulls knife from the folds of her pelts, puts it in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Islene looks to her naked belly. The baby inside presses against its womb, a visible impression on her flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no time, husband. I would see my child's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Islene's eyes flutter as she struggles. Corin lowers the knife. Islene's eyes lock with Corin's as he puts the kni to use. Never once does she scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later, Corin lifts the crying, blood-covered BOY through the falling snowflakes to Islene's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boy. He will be strong. A warrior with no equal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not speak, love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have never been able to still my tongue, and you will not this day. He will be wild, Corin. You must temper him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shares one kiss with her child, its first taste not o mother's milk, but of her blood. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan. His--name--is--Conan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy's eyes are as deep and blue as the Eastern Sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small Cimmerian village lies in a heavily forested vall a redoubt from the icy mountains surrounding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Round wooden huts surround a stone-lined pit, where young CIMMERIAN BOYS, ages 12-15 stand. Pollen drifts through t air, giving it an ethereal haze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the center of the pit URAN, an elder Cimmerian warrior speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Cimmerian warrior is like any other man. A Cimmerian warrior feels hunger. He feels cold. Like other men he may lie and cheat. (stares the boys down) But when a Cimmerian warrior hungers, he hungers only for the blood of his enemy. When he feels cold, it is the cold steel of his sword. When he lies, he lies in wait for his enemy. And when he cheats, he cheats death itself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uran stops at the end of the line, where a boy stands a g two heads smaller than the rest. He is no more than eight but his face is as stoic, driven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan! You are too young to be here. Withdraw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONAN, determined, doesn't move an inch. The LARGEST TEEN menacingly steps up to the smaller boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said leave, motherless whelp. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hulking teen goes to shove Conan, but Conan pulls his towards him, lashing out with his other hand, punching th teen in the throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The large boy goes down hard, hands and knees, gasping fo air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smattering of LAUGHS erupt from the boys, quickly silen by Uran's stare. Uran hands out RIVER STONES to each boy, ending with Conan. The boys know what to do: they put the large stones in their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the black crag in the high pass stands a wooden training sword. The one who claims it, with stone still in his mouth, will have earned the right to train with the warriors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys look at each other, sizing up the competition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? What are you waiting for?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And off they run. They knock each other down, punching th other's stomachs, each trying to force the other to expel their stones. One or two succeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the remaining boys run for the trail that winds h into the mountains. But a few head right for the sheer cl face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan follows the ones headed to the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when the Cimmerian boys climb, it is a sight to behol They find cracks we can barely see and scale the smooth r face as though it were a ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hulking teen reaches for the same handhold as Conan, trying to knock him off. Conan swings with one hand and f another path. In moments he is ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan is in the lead as he crests the cliff top, the bigg boys right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race through the forest, heading uphill --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Conan spots movement ahead. He pauses -- 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the largest teen elbows past Conan, into the lead. Th boy runs two paces more and suddenly flies off his feet, AXE lodged squarely in his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the boys stop. Out of the dense forest come

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Covered with fearsome war paint and armed with dual hand axes, the rotting heads of their enemies are slung at the waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys spit out the rocks in their mouths and YELL. The turn and run in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only Conan doesn't move, even as another boy pulls at him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan! Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Conan simply pulls the axe from his large boy's skull turns to face the Picts, his eyes burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Picts LAUGH and CHARGE CONAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin arrives with Uran and other armed CIMMERIAN WARRIOR They get a brief glimpse of a single PICT, escaping in th other direction. One of the Cimmerians takes off in pursu Corin desperately searches for his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan? Conan?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan steps forward from out of a thicket, his body cover in Pict blood. Three PICTS lie massacred, the bodies hack to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan walks past the other stunned Cimmerians, up to his father. Conan SPITS OUT the bloody stone from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They killed one. I killed three. I am a warrior now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uran and the other Cimmerian men exchange worried glances Looking at the carved up bodies of the Picts, they are aghast. Conan looks confused. Why aren't they happy? 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warrior? What you have done a jackal would do. Never a warrior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They would have done the same --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I said, jackals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not ready. I will forge him myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan is tested under Corin's watchful eye:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Forced to sleep in the snow, while his father keeps war inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - A heavy boulder on his shoulder blades while he balance wet river rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Climbing a cliff face, his bare hands leaving blood beh on the jagged rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flames reflect in the blue eyes of Conan as he works the bellows of the forge. Sparks buzz like angry fireflies as stokes the blaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin sharpens a sword, perfecting it. Conan cannot take eyes off it, stepping away from the bellows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoke your fire, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan slams the bellows closed, anger rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Stoke your fire, chop your wood." I have slept where wolves dare not. I have balanced a thousand river stones. When will you teach me the sword?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin stares his son in the eyes. Judging. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you're ready? Then tell me: what is a sword's purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To slay ones enemies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That is what it does. Its purpose is why you use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses Conan two lumps of ore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, which makes the best sword?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan takes the two lumps, testing them. He hands his fat back one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stronger ore, eh? Then we shall make a sword of it, and tomorrow you will show me what brute strength yields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a setting sun silhouetting the two, Conan attacks Co Conan attacks with fury. Corin defends with grace. Until boy overextends and Corin slashes down a counterattack th SHATTERS CONAN'S SWORD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin simply turns and walks away, leaving Conan to puzzl what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin lowers his sword and walks away, leaving Conan to puzzle what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan works the bellows, putting his back into it. Corin places both ores in the furnace where they begin to melt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did it break? 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it had no life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparks fly as Corin pounds on the glowing edge of the swo with hammer. Corin nods at Conan, who sprinkles the glowi blade with ash.

dialogues.speaker: CORIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The strongest blade isn't made of the hardest steel, boy. The hardest ore is what a man will die for. It is strong and unyielding. It neither cowers nor concedes. But without the softer ore, it can be shattered like glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steam rises as Corin lowers the blade into a freezing sla tub, only to place it right back into the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The softer ore is what a man lives for. It is flexible and lasting. It survives, even against the greatest of foes. But too much of the soft ore, the blade will not cut deep enough when it must.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin fashions the blade's hilt, engraving the guard and pommel. It is a work of art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sword must be tempered, the two ores united through fire and ice. Through its suffering the sword comes to hold both life and death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin hands Conan the sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now tell me, what is this sword's purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan furrows his brow, trying to puzzle the answer. He can't. Corin's disappointment shows. He takes the sword f Conan's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one is not ready yet. 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood rushes to Conan's face but he says nothing. He rush out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Conan slashes through a field of reeds, cutti everything within reach of him, expending his rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him something moves in the forest. We catch just a glimpse of the PICT, the same one that escaped Conan in t earlier scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan's instincts cause him to spin around -- but then there's nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Built into the side of a huge tree, fifty feet up, this wooden structure houses two CIMMERIAN SENTRIES. A BIRD CR in the woods, causing one of the sentries to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THWICK! He suddenly stands up straight, unmoving. The one still sitting in the structure notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The standing sentry falls backwards, revealing an ARROW piercing his right eye. Shocked, the remaining sentry rea for the WARNING HORN mounted on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as he reaches for it, his shadow becomes three dimensional, MORPHING into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thin, feral humanoid, bodies covered in tattoos, from t deepest jungles of Zingara. The scout lashes out with his black sword and cuts straight across the sentry's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Shadow Scout's name is REMO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remo exits and stares down at CHEREN, a BLIND ARCHER clad lamellar armor and a conical sedge hat. Cheren has an arr notched and ready, but somehow he knows not to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheren lowers his bow and lets out a BIRD WHISTLE -- 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the forest comes alive. The forces are an odd combination; massive KUSHITE TRIBESMEN, dark-skinned sava from the savannahs of Kush, and a LEGION OF AQUILONIAN MERCENARIES, heavily armored knights drawn from the citie Aquilonia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their leaders, respectively, are the six foot-five Kushit chief UKAFA, gold-toothed, his body painted for battle, a the handsome, silver-armored Aquilonian LUCIUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the last of their guard towers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this sneaking around for a lowly tribe of barbarians.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: This lowly tribe of barbarians have buried every warrior ever to set foot on this land, Lucius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KHALAR SINGH, a warlord atop a black horse, rides through fog-shrouded trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bears a nomadic visage, with tanned skin and almond-sh eyes. While his voice is calm, his eyes burn with malice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is only because they have never faced my legion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar regards Lucius with amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then show us. But should you fail, remember the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucius scowls as he delivers a bow to Khalar Singh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin walks out of the forge, looking around for Conan. Various other Cimmerians go about the daily routine, but Conan is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan? 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin looks to the ridge above the village, noticing a th fog creeping in. The fog curls and eddies, something is o there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Lucius and his legion of silver-armored warrior burst out of the fog, attacking with speed and strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Cimmerians are hardly caught flat footed. In seco they are armed, and they counter the charge with a furiou charge of their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM! Sword and bone collide as the two enemy fronts smas into each other. And the battle devolves into one-on-ones

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the barbarians have the upper hand. Uran and Corin the main push of battle-frenzied barbarians as they swing their huge broadswords, extending their reach advantage o the Aquilonian's shorter weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And quickly, the Aquilonian's numbers are cut in half. Co squares off against Lucius himself. Lucius is sweating. Worried. It wasn't supposed to be this hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retreat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a unit, the Aquilonians race back into the woods. In seconds, the Cimmerians give chase in wild pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Hold your ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's too late, nearly half the Cimmerian warriors are gone on the chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucius and the Aquilonians race up to a sheer cliff face. Nowhere left to run. They turn to see the Cimmerians gathering in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death is in the air, invaders. Can you taste it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed. I savor it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uran notices something is wrong. His eyes go skyward. Ato the cliff stand Cheren and a dozen more of his blind arch bows at the ready with FLAMING ARROWS. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They let the arrows fly, streaking balls of flame heading right for the Cimmerians. But they do not hit them. They the tree trunks beside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for a moment, the Cimmerians look relieved, until the notice small bags of a black substance tied to the arrows The flames lick at the substance --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABOOM! The forest erupts into flames as the Cimmerian warriors are burned alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan spins, started by the sound of the explosion. He se flames rising above the treetops beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He races back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin sees the flames in the distance as well. Suddenly, Ukafa and his Kushite warriors erupt out of the forest. A with fearsome barbed spears they charge the remaining Cimmerians, savage against savage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Kushites are not alone. From behind the Cimmerian comes, AKHUN, a massive four hundred pounds of flesh, wea loops of chains like armor, leads his turbaned TURANIAN HORSEMEN into the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cimmerian WOMEN arm themselves, but the Horsemen atta with NINE TAILED WHIPS pulling their swords from their ha and dragging them to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Horsemen quickly gather up the women while Ukafa and men keep the Cimmerian warriors all too occupied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan rushes through a river, now tinged red with blood, reaches the far end of the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huts burn, women are chained, only a handful of Cimmerian still stand. Lucius and his Aquilonian mercenaries are helping the Spearmen slay the wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan grabs a fallen sword and rushes for the nearest Aquilonian and RUNS HIM THROUGH. A ZINGARAN spots him and rushes him with his spear. Conan readies himself for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the Zingaran loses his head, lopped off by Corin's blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin, sporting a deep gash to his abdomen, pulls a reluc Conan from the battle, back toward the forge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flames of the forge still burn as Corin pushes Conan the room. He bolts the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we need more weapons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin drops his sword, then struggles to lift a heavy gra in the dirt floor. Beneath it a trough of cooling water l under the hut and away from the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. There is a hunting lodge in the North Pass with provisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I will fight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin grabs Conan by his tunic, pulling him up to his fac Corin's eyes are half-crazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fight is over, but yours has just begun. You wanted to be a warrior of the tribe, Conan--now you must be its last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, I am not afraid to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Make your death have purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM. Something slams at the door. It does not budge. Aga BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow appears under the door, sliding into the forge, MATERIALIZING into the form of Remo. Remo quickly slides the bolt. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In rush enter Lucius and Ukafa. Corin and Conan face thei attackers, fighting in close quarters. Lucius rushes at Conan, only for Conan to duck under his attack and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROW HIM IN THE FIERY FORGE. Lucius SCREAMS in agony, ri up to reveal half of his formerly handsome face burned to crisp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin fights Ukafa to a standstill, until Remo emerges fr the shadows behind him and drives a short sword into his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin falls to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucius delivers a massive backhand, sending Conan flying backwards -- and demolishing one of the Forge's main supp beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half of the forge comes crashing down on top of Conan, pinning his bleeding form to the ground, just a few feet his fallen father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, Lucius turns his anger to Corin, raising his swo to deliver the killing blow.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I said I wanted a word with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucius stays his hand as Khalar Singh steps into the forg Beside him stands the PICT who escaped from Conan earlier grinning from ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh hands him a bag of gold.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strange dialect -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their heads. You promised me their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you wish, once we are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pict nods and heads off, drawing his knife. Khalar Si stares down at Corin, sizing him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin lifts up into a sitting position, back to the forge 15.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I take no pleasure in this day, barbarian. Your people are fierce warriors, deserving of every story told of them. But now you must choose the story for yourself. I am Khalar Singh. My army is handpicked from the best Hyboria. My second, Ukafa, and his Kushite horde. Remo and his Shadow Scouts from the jungles of Zingara. And countless others. They all had a day like this one. They all chose a way forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the forge walks Cherin and Akhun. The lieutenants st behind Corin, eyeing Corin with malice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin catches a glimpse of Conan, buried but staring back him, unable to move. Corin quickly turns away, careful no give his son away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seek neither gold nor steel, but flesh and blood. The last of a royal line that goes back three thousand years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Royalty in Cimmeria? Never. Each man is free here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I seek a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar looks outside the door of the forge. The Cimmerian women are being herded by the slavers.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A queen in hiding. Point her out and you'll spare the lives of your own. Perhaps even your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My wife was killed, long ago, by swine such as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar nods, understanding. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then our stories began in the same place, Cimmerian. I too lost my wife to marauders. How many men, in how many lands have suffered so? The only answer is power, strength unfettered, the kind of which can unite all Hyboria under a single crown. That is the legacy I seek. Will you join me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a powerful, convincing speech. But Corin holds his tongue, unmoved.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Very well. Then death will be your story. Your men will die. And your women too, when I am done with them. None will survive to carry your name forth, and over time, even your enemies will forget you ever were. You will be wiped from the pages of history. (to his men) Take your blood, but leave the kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one, the lieutenants beat and stab Corin, taking pleasure in his pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan struggles, trying to move, to yell, to do anything other than lie there. But a huge timber lies upon his bac pinning him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fariq! Come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entering the wrecked forge is FARIQ, the six year old son Khalar Singh. He stares at Corin's bleeding form with the dispassion of a sociopath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar picks up THE SWORD Corin and Conan had forged together, the one Corin took away. He admires it, then ha it to his son. He keeps a hand on it as it is too heavy f his son to lift alone. He instructs his son as if teachin him multiplication.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Before you lies our enemy. His tribe waits for him in the beyond. What would you do? 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would cut out his eyes, father, so that he will not find them. So he will wander the afterlife forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me your strength, Fariq. Without it, you will never rule. With it, you will never be forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq DRIVES THE SWORD INTO CORIN'S EYE. Corin doesn't ma sound. Once Fariq has ripped out Corin's eyes, Khalar run Corin through.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have your desire. Death has found you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corin spits out his last words, also meant for Conan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon -- it comes for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan glimpses around the faces of Khalar and his men, ea image seared into his memory as if ablaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burn this place. It no longer exists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The forge is lit afire from a half dozen torches, thrown its roof and inside its windows. Khalar and the other wat as the building roars into flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke fills the air. Conan struggles, still unable to mov He COUGHS, dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then the fire collapses more of the forge, and the falling beams shatter the one that pins Conan to the grou 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, painfully, Conan drags himself into the cooling trough that runs beneath the hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan exits the forge only to see the entire village burn The bodies of everyone he has ever known litter the landscape. Nothing stirs. Until he hears a strange CHOPPI SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan spots the Pict, who is decapitating a dead Cimmeria warrior, adding to the collection of heads at his tattooe waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pict doesn't notice as Conan slips up behind him, the RUNS HIM THROUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the wide-eyed Pict dies, Conan takes the sword and CUT NOTCH into his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where there was once a single notch, there are now FIVE s notches, on a much broader arm that struggles to pin anot powerful looking arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raucous bar on the Argossean waterfront. Out the window see a port lined with Shemish galleys and junks from Kush

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bar is filled with the hearty sailors and merchants o those ships, and those who desire to part them from their hard-earned money; Zamoran thieves, Hyborean mercenaries Brythunian whores. Most of them watch the arm wrestling m taking place at the back of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of CITY GUARDS, short swords sheathed at their sid enter the bar and are immediately summoned over by the harried BARKEEP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barkeep motion to the arm wrestlers. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this one done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he done?! What hasn't he done? He's bedded six of my whores and finished off three casks of mead--and he hasn't paid so much as a silver piece for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So have your men deal with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the bar, six men each hold down two HULKING MEN YELLING in agony as their horribly broken arms are snappe back into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a real problem. Too bad we have other places to be right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Barkeep shakes his head, knowing the routine. He slip pair of silver pieces into the soldier's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get that behemoth out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two City Guards make their way to the back of the bar His back to them, the DRUNKEN MAN they're after struggles pin his opponent, cobras beneath each of their wrists, re to strike at the loser. A pair of voluptuous WHORES watch caressing the Drunken Man's sinewy back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Drunken Man YELLS in fury as he SLAMS the other man's hand down upon the cobra, which immediately bites its pre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the soldiers arrive, the drunken victor throws his tan of ale at the Barkeep, who's now back behind the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss-water! You'll serve my friends and I your best, barman, or you'll taste steel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to leave, northerner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Drunken Man turns as the City Guard puts a hand on hi shoulder. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gangly fifteen year old boy has grown into a powerful built man, broad-shouldered with sun browned skin lined w battle scars. Only the piercing blue eyes and square cut black mane remain from the boy we last saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan stands to his full height, looming over the smaller City Guards, who instinctively take a step back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, my small friends. It's time to die. Now--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan sways. The room spins. He falls on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's first --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan, unconscious, is dragged down the street by the two City Guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the gods, he's as heavy as a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even a dead horse smells better than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The City Guards drag Conan into a broad prison yard. Many the INMATES are shackled together, hacking with picks at rock walls on their work detail. Those in no condition to break rock are left in their own filth to rot. Some are e dead already, the rats gnawing at the remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two City Guards drag Conan into the guardhouse, where LIEUTENANT sits eating his dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant doesn't even bother to look up from his me 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the charge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Public drunkenness. Another damn hill ape who can't handle his liquor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so, boy? How do you plead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan yawns in response. One of the City Guards slaps Con hard, across the face. Conan slowly opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Captain of the Guard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCREAMS OF PAIN come from down the hall, past a locked do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cells, interrogating a prisoner. And you'll get the same if you don't answer. You're accused of public drunkenness. How do you plead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In truth, I've been guilty of much. Jewels stolen from the crowns of kings, men's heads split in battle for the price of a night's drink. But through that I've searched and waited and hunted my prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Conan shifts upright, looking more sober than he a moment ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But drink? Haven't had a drop all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards holding Conan up by his arms, suddenly find th arms wrapped around their heads. Twist, twist. SNAP. SNAP breaks both their necks in an instant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant is horrified. He goes for his sword. Conan bats it out of his hand, slamming his head against the ba wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key to the cells. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it. There's a guard inside the door. Only he can open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan picks up the Lieutenant's sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't kill me! He'll only open the door for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLASH OF STEEL as Conan delivers a blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD sits on a stool next to a heavy metal door. Behin him, the CAPTAIN OF THE GUARD beats a chained ONE-EYED PRISONER to a pulpy mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: MUFFLED VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Need to see the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard exhales, frustrated. He stands up, getting his out. He stops. Opens the small EYEHOLE to see into the ot room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lieutenant stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only to see Conan standing there, holding the decapitated head of the Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shocked Guard goes for his sword. Conan swings the Lieutenant's head, smashing it into the Guard's jaw and putting him down for the count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when the Captain of the Guard turns around. And WE RECOGNIZE HIM! He's LUCIUS, the disfigured Aquilionian wh was one of Khalar Singh's lieutenants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men! 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From around a corner come five more Guards, drawing their weapons. Lucius draws his as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made a huge mistake, ape. You'll never make it out of this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came for you, Lucius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucius nods to the guards, who advance on Conan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk as though you know me, ape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. And I am no ape. I am Cimmerian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As recognition crosses Lucius' face, Conan springs into action. He KICKS the table at the men, sending the knives other torture implements flying right into the first guar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second guard tries leaping over the falling table. Co just grabs him in midair and throws him even faster into iron bands of the prisoner cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucius lunges at Conan, Conan steps in on him, grabbing h sword hand. In a show of strength, he twists Lucius' own sword until points down at the floor, then THRUSTS IT THR LUCIUS' FOOT AND DEEP INTO THE WOOD FLOOR BELOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucius BELLOWS in pain, pinned to the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next three Guards rush forward, forcing Conan to deal with three weapons attacks at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first to strike swings a mace and chain that wraps ar Conan's sword and he tries to yank it free from Conan's g Instead, Conan pulls him in a wide circle, sending him fl into a wall-mounted torch. The guard burns like dry kindl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second to strike hits Conan on his sword hand, carvin deep gash and causing him to drop his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan turns to face him, eyes filled with rage. The guard face goes pale. Conan head butts him with all his might a the guard goes down, bleeding from mouth, nose and ears. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However, the last Guard is upon Conan before he can react The powerful soldier uses the shaft of his poleax to lift Conan off his feet and back against the far wall, pinned the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan struggles to breathe, the polearm shaft driving his throat into the wall. The thickness of the Cimmerian's ne gives him time to reach into his bracer, pulling out a hi knife which he buries into the Guardsman's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucius SCREAMS in pain as Conan pours water on the burnin guard, and lifts the table back onto its legs. Then he pu the sword out of the floor, a thick plume of blood rising of Lucius' now liberated foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan takes Lucius' face and smashes it against the table Lucius looks, aghast, as Conan takes his injured hand and places it over the torch flame, searing the wound closed. Cimmerian never even bats an eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want? Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan turns his face to the burnt side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one who made you pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible! You're dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan shows Lucius the FIVE SCARS running down his forear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I am death. And I came a long way for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan lifts the sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!! Wait!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you where the rest are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end of the earth. You kill me, and you'll never find them. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you offering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think? All of them. Ukafa, Remo, Cheren, Akhun -- and Khalar Singh himself. But you have to swear you won't kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have my word. You tell me where I will find Khalar Singh, and I will not kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan lets Lucius go. Lucius hobbles to his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is in a city called on the edge of the Eastern Sea. On the edge of Hyboria. Khor Khalba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan looks him in his eyes, sizing him up. He likes what sees. In a flash, Conan grabs Lucius' head again, yanking back, exposing his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave your word!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan rips a SMALL KEY from a large keyring. He drops it Lucius' throat. The big man chokes instantly. A second la Conan pours ale from a flagon down his throat as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucius swallows the key, gasping for breath as Conan rele him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toasting, to our deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan swings his sword and cuts the One Eyed Prisoner fro the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go. You are free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One-Eye looks at his wrists and ankles, still hobbled by shackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't get far like this. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan hands him a fallen Guardsmen's sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key to your shackles sits in the Captain's gut. Happy hunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The One-Eyed Prisoner grins with malice. As he closes in the terrified Lucius, Conan heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbarian! I had your word! You said you would spare my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I said I wouldn't kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Lucius SCREAMS OF PAIN as Conan walks out into th night, cutting another notch into his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KHALAR SINGH looks older. Worn. He squints as he stares i a howling sandstorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UKAFA trudges through the deep sand to reach him. The sandstorm is so blinding we don't see him until he is les than five feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh, we've lost half our cavalry legion, and still Fariq presses on! We must turn back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says the Queen is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads us in circles. He knows nothing of leading an army --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care, Ukafa. You hold a special place in my kingdom, but blood you are not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My apologies, Khalar Singh. I am simply concerned for your army. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I would gladly sacrifice every last man to get my hands on the Queen. And in that respect, Fariq has my confidence. He knows more of the legends of Acheron than anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, two forms race at them from the blinding sand. and FARIQ. No longer a child, Fariq is now a man in his twenties, but he is hardly the strong warrior his father His frame is slight, his eyes beady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father, they are here! The hidden oasis, just as it was written.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh looks to Remo for confirmation. The misshape and shadowy Remo nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remo and Fariq lead Khalar and Ukafa into a natural tunne carved out of rock. Inside, the sandstorm no longer rages

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And on the other side of the tunnel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A protected rock oasis, heavy vegetation crawling up the encircling cliff walls, herds of sheep grazing on fields grass. At its far end, beyond a deep blue pond, lies a Gr influenced monastery and several tiled-roof, mud-brick houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And moving between the pools are MEN and WOMEN going abou their simple chores. They wear long flowing white linen r and turbans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air and sand are perfectly still within the perimeter the oasis. But beyond it, the sandstorm rages all around, sand hurled violently hundreds of feet into the air, swir around the oasis as though it were the eye of some mystic hurricane, protected by an unseen force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of robed YOUNG WOMEN kneel in front of one of the reflecting pools, quietly reading from prayer books and softly striking their right breast with a left hands wrap in thorns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One girl, ILIRA, mischievously taps the shoulder of the g next to her with her thorn. The girl, TAMARA, squeals in pain, angry her prayer was interrupted. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilira is the fun-loving dilettante of the relationship. Tamara the studious good girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! I'm trying to pray!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then hit yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara hits Ilira back with her thorn. Ilira SQUEALS, the hits a grinning Tamara back. Tamara grabs her, but as the

dialogues.speaker: FASSIR, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Is that how one shows penitence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both girls instantly stop as FASSIR appears behind them. Fassir is an elder monk and leader of the monastery. He shakes his head, both out of fondness and disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I expect more from a queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Fassir. I just tire of saying the same prayer every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you should be able to translate it from its original Acheronian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilira's face scrunches, unsure. Tamara steps in to help I save face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course she can. She even taught it to me. "Never again."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never again will we stand by as darkness consumes the world. Never again will innocents suffer for others' power. Never again will the Queen suffer so Acheron may rise. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, Tamara. You must have taught her very well indeed, Ilira.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile on Fassir's face confirms he knows the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the monastery's BELL RINGS OUT. A moment later, temple EXPLODES in flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pouring out from the swirling sands come Khalar Singh's a Cheren and his archers stand atop Khalar's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive siege engine atop which CHEREN and his archers FLAMING ARROWS. The arrows arc down and explode as they impact the tiled roofs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting at the highest point of the Man Of War, Khalar Si likes what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monks scatter in every direction, but wherever they t more troops burst out of the swirling sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small handful of armed MONKS display acrobatic martial prowess as they battle with Khalar's heavily armed forces but they are vastly outnumbered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fassir grabs Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen must not be captured. Take her out the North Gate. Quickly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara grabs Ilira and pulls her through the flaming battleground. Zingaran warriors cut down the monks while Turanian horsemen concentrate on the women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are caught, everything we live for is lost!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP! A whip encircles Ilira's waist. A massive TURANIAN pulls her to him. Tamara grabs the whip, pulling Ilira th other way. But she is no match for the huge slaver. He ya on the whip pulling both of them to him -- 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only then does he notice Tamara's unsheathed knife which plunges into his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She frees Ilira and they run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thin alleyway at the rear of the monastery, leading awa from the din of battle, towards a rear gate of the oasis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara and Ilira run for the gate, only for the shadows o the alleyway to move and shift -- REMO and three of his shadow scouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They advance on the women, drawing dark shortswords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No swords. Khalar needs them alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara lunges for the nearest shadow scout with her knife but when she strikes, she hits nothing but shadow. It ref behind her and grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another grabs Ilira. Tamara launches her body into the ai executing a backflip that puts her behind the shadow scou quick knife strike and he goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with one continuous motion, she vaults over the shado scout holding Tamara, cutting his throat as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remo and the remaining scout give chase, blending in and of shadows. But each time they strike, Tamara defends Ili They near the far end of the alleyway, the North gate loo ahead with the desert beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remo blends into another shadow --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remo materializes out of a shadow atop the Man Of War, ne to Cheren, the archer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The north gate. Destroy it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheren and the other archers turn their fire to the gate the end of the passage. They fire a volley of fiery arrow 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara and Ilira run for the whirling sands just ahead -- when the flaming arrows land before them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilira hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll die if we stay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She locks eyes with Ilira, who nods. Together they run ri for the arrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But at the last minute, Ilira falters. She falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara turns to see Ilira lying in the gateway a moment t late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ARROWS EXPLODE causing a cave in that closes the gate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara falls to the sand as the gate collapses behind her She looks back, only to see that Ilira didn't make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh stares at the cloud of destruction at the no tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, one form hurries into the swirling sandstorm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was guarding that gate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was I, Lord. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take four legions. Hunt her. Before I hunt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara stumbles through a stretch of barren wasteland, th plumes of the oasis' sandstorm now off in the distance be her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun mercilessly beats down upon her face, her lips ar already chapped. She falls to her knees, unable to go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up, as the heat streams off the desert floor, creating a swirling mirage. Through which the silhouette rider appears, followed by others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horse-drawn carts of the caravan are lined with iron bars, and behind the bars are a bevy of young women, most looking worse for wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HEAD SLAVER rides ahead, and walks up to the heap of white cloth that is Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water -- please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts her barely conscious head, eyeing her features, greasy paw examining her body. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gods are good. (to the other slavers) Chain this one in my cage. She'll be the prize of the auction in Khor Kalba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man of War dominates the center of the oasis, its tor illuminating the scene before it. Akhun and the Turanians hold chains connected to the twenty women monks, kneeling with their wrists chained to their neck collars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of them kneels Fassir, beaten and bloodied. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh, Fariq, and Ukafa step down from the Man of Fariq carries with him a large iron box with ornate carvi on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these years searching the ends of the earth. And here you are. Just a two day ride from Khor Kalba. I can scarcely believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Acheronian, to monks) Say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Say nothing. Maybe he doesn't know who we are. Maybe he's not looking for the Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the women look up at him, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's right, my brethren, you have been lied to all your lives. Told you must hide yourselves, told you were alone. I want you to look at me, and see me for what I am. A brother. A friend. I have come not to hurt you, but liberate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come for your own dark purposes, to raise Acheron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I come to resurrect the greatest empire Hyboria has ever known.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empire of evil, soaked in blood sacrifice and the blackest of magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh becomes infuriated, eyes blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you hidden from the world so long that you cannot to see? Blood, magic, death: it is everywhere. Acheron is no different than any other kingdom, but for its glory.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And in place of that glory, you offer shame? I knew shame, but that was before I was shown my true lineage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar draws closer to the women, looking them each in th eye.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When I was but a child, raiders destroyed my village, cut our fathers to ribbons, and burned our women as sacrifice to foreign gods. Those few who survived, we ran for our lives, chased into caves at the edge of the Eastern Sea, left with nothing to live for. But then we discovered it. Acheron. The temple that spawned an empire. We learned that we were not broken goat- herders on a desolate coastline. We were the sons and daughters of kings. (stares in Ilira's eyes) And queens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He motions to Fariq, who brings the iron box forward.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For thirty years I have searched for you. In that time I built both an army and empire, but they are nothing compared to what we can create together. We can raise Acheron again. Never again will we hide like rats. Never again will we watch as our loved ones are slaughtered. I call forth the Queen. Stand and join me, and this day will have a joyous end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would have all the world suffer, as you have suffered. We will die before we help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to his son. He paces in front of the female monks the box in front of them. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caves beneath Khor Khalba contain all manner of creature, many -- altered -- by centuries of blood magic. But one, in particular, has developed a special connection to the blood. A thirst. It is said that only the Queen of Acheron itself can resist its embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, one woman away from Ilira.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what say you? Will you be the lucky one, or will you tell me who is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear falls down her face, but she stays silent. There's sound of SLITHERING as Fariq opens the box. She stares do inside the box --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She awakens to the SCREAMING of a whipped SLAVE GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara's eyes are met by a dozen others, SLAVES of every color, chained together with her in a CAGED WAGON. The SL TRADER swings his whip twice more, hitting the cowering w in the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, slags! Smile! A new owner approaches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara makes eye contact with the Slave Trader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go. I promise you'll be rewarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Trader just laughs, leering at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I would sample that reward, fair one, but you wear white.

dialogues.speaker: SLAVE TRADER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me, have the stars aligned and delivered a virgin slave into my care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He eyes her lasciviously. Tamara turns away and does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: SLAVE TRADER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No matter. I'll know soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good day, sir! A lone rider in a desolate land. The perfect customer for what I sell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rides out of the sun, his massive form silhouetted by the bright desert sky. He stares at the slave wagons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, master! Your gold can free me from this hole! I can bring you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Slave Trader immediately WHIPS her, incensed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence whore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Slaver goes to whip her again, but before the blow ca fall, Conan grabs his arm. The Slave Trader looks furious but Conan's size holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khor Kalba. Which way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the road to Khor Kalba. Ahead. Past the Great Wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Slaver nods to the east and Conan releases his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Slaver continues whipping the slave. Conan just rides - not his problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as Conan passes Tamara, for a brief moment their eyes meet. Something about her. Conan stares a moment, then sp his horse on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, the ground around them RUMBLES. Horses rear, t women SCREAM. Conan turns and looks up. His eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming thundering down the hills on all sides. The SLAVER see them a moment to late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM. Several of the horses and carts are smashed by the rolling boulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan kicks his horse, trying to outrace the boulders. Bu when the wagon next to him is hit, its axle spears his ho in its side, and Conan goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pissed, he draws his sword. The Slavers scramble around t broken wagons, in chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a pair of wagons still stands. One of them holds Tam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use your whips on the horses' legs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Slavers are confused. Then they notice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: racing down the hill, behind the boulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the riders bear down upon the slavers, the Slavers do they're told, entangling the legs of the first wave of horses, throwing their riders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than a few riders SNAP their necks as they're driven into the desert floor. The remainder fight hand to hand, are cut down by either Conan's blade or the slavers' tulw But their victory is short lived --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a SECOND WAVE OF RIDERS comes thundering towards them, before the Slavers can re-establish their perimeter. The riders start cutting the slavers down where they stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan lodges his sword in a still-rolling boulder. As it rolls, it pulls him up on top of it. From this height, Co launches himself down at the horsemen below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! He knocks a rider off his horse, Conan landing squa in the saddle. He kicks the horse straight at the other riders. They don't see him coming until it's too late. He cuts them down where they sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last remaining CARAVAN DRIVER whips his horse team, trying to pull his wagon out of the fight. Conan spins to a FLASH of steel and the rider's neck plumes in blood as decapitated. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is strange since the cavalry are nowhere near the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explanation comes as the shadow behind the driver MOR into Remo, the spindly Shadow Scout. He takes the reins, stopping the wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan spots him, recognition in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a SCREAM. Conan turns to see the other two SHADOW SCOUTS already hacking their way through the slaves on on the caged wagons. A Shadow Scout gets to Tamara, only to her FIGHT BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara kicks the first Scout in the face, slamming his he into the bars. However, the second one clubs her unconsci from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaps from his horse, launching his body at Remo. Remo di and rolls away. Small and misshapen, he is nonetheless ve fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan strikes again. Again Remo dodges out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shadow Scouts draw swords, but Remo waves them off, speaking in the broken language of a savage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl! Bring her to Khalar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan launches an all out attack. Remo leaps over his swo and vaults Conan, landing on his back. He draws his sword preparing to cut Conan's throat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Conan hurls his body backwards, into one of the huge rolling boulders. The impact crushes Remo and he loses hi grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan spins to strike again, only to see Remo MELT INTO T SHADOW OF THE BOULDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan turns his attention towards the other two Shadow Sc as they drag the unconscious Tamara away. 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan mounts one of the cavalry horses and gallops toward the Scouts. They see him coming and let go of Tamara. THE MELT AWAY INTO HER SHADOW AND DISAPPEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazed, she struggles to her feet. Conan appears beside he his dagger out. Tamara gasps in fear but Conan only reach out and breaks the lock on her chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cuts the bonds on her feet. Tamara rises up, the battl scene revealed to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead bodies of the Slavers and Turanian horsemen lie spra in every direction. Tamara takes in the gruesome sight, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many died to capture nobody. (motions to his horse) Get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I don't wish to ride with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan rides his horse, Tamara trailing on foot, wrists tethered to Conan's saddle by a long rope. Tamara looks exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach a gallery of broken columns, spires of fossili coral that juts out of the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! I want water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan just keeps riding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps the slavers took your orders. I don't. 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew men could be so cruel. Now I wonder if the world is filled with animals such as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak of animals as if they were less than men. But animals don't stab their brothers in the back or steal their mother's only possession. And they never lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan get off his horse, unties Tamara and gives her a wa sack. Tamara greedily drinks down the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. Give me your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Tamara Amelia Karushan. And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Conan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan? That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What more names do I need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan then grabs Tamara around her waist, putting her ato his horse. He then mounts behind her, their bodies close. Conan's mouth is only inches from her ear as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is only one truth I need from you, Tamara Amelia Karushan. Why does Khalar Singh want you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara looks away, but doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's hope it's for your cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A campfire amidst several large boulders, a line of windm on the horizon. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara struggles to manage a cooking pot over a blaze. Co comes over and smells the pot; his face scrunches from th odor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to poison me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara steps back and gets down on her knees, her hands clasped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we eat, I must pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crom! What would you pray for? That a bone may not get stuck in your throat? No words nor gods will give you one more moment than fate allows you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you have no faith. And I am sorry for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need no pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you do. You live in a world that is harsh and short. Where fate is unyielding and hope is a cruel joke. I live in a world with a purpose that guides me, where faith sustains me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Conan KICKS DIRT PAST TAMARA, ONTO THE FIRE. Th fire goes out, plunging everything into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, there's the sound of FIGHTING. Grunting, blows being interchanged, then a LOUD SNAP AS BONES ARE BROKEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later, the flames of the fire are stoked up agai revealing Conan standing over the groaning REMO. The othe two SHADOW SCOUTS are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara instinctively jumps back. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. His back is broken. He won't be slinking away this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tamara gapes at Remo, Conan simply pulls the cooking p off the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let's eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- what about him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remo GROANS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I enjoy a little music with my meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across steep valleys and up jagged peaks we race into ste and unforgiving mountains. Far off, we hear a pair of thunderous booms, almost like the sound of a heartbeat. THUMP, THUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cresting over a set of peaks, a gorge is revealed below,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A city carved out of the purple granite of a mountainous gorge. Hundred-foot towers rise up, their pinnacles craft to depict ANGRY, GOD-LIKE FACES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we pass one of the faces, again we hear the sound of a thunderous heartbeat, now closer. THUMP, THUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We GLIDE DOWN past hundred foot high pillars of flames, towards the growing sounds of SCREAMING and WAILING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets of Acheron are lined with thousands of SLAVES young and old, chained together, toiling under the lash o their cruel masters, the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Towering over the slaves, the warriors are a fearsome sig Their armor, crafted from the bones of their defeated enemies, rises to a mask which covers much of their featu 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the red irises of their eyes peer through. That and their pitch black skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slaves hobble down the main boulevard, their naked fe splashing in streams of BLOOD which flow from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead looms a colossal pyramid, surrounded in a semi- circle by five massive statues. As we grow closer the grotesque surface of the pyramid becomes clearer, one hew from cracked bone and empty sockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thunderous heartbeat seems all around us now. THUMP, THUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three hundred foot high edifice is made ENTIRELY OF THOUSANDS OF HUMAN SKULLS. Many of the skulls still drip blood, pouring down from the pyramid's crest, where stand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Images of snakes gorging themselves on hapless victims ar carved in bas relief into the throne's surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing before the throne, surrounded by BLACK ROBED PRI are a man and woman, mere shadows in the silhouette of torches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HEAD PRIEST and his ACOLYTE approach with TWO CROWNS. is made of GOLD, the other of IRON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gold crown goes on the head of the man. For the woman the Iron crown is placed on her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And suddenly, THUMP, THUMP. IRON SPIKES SHOOT OUT OF THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood streams down the woman's face as she turns toward t torchlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara leaps up, startled. Her face is covered in sweat, eyes as terrified as the victim from her dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby we hear screaming of another type. Remo. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUFFLED SCREAMS. We pull out of Remo's wide mouth, stuffe with cloth, trying to bellow in uncontrollable agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand comes in and pulls out the cloth. It's Conan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! Mercy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are more fit to inflict torture than to endure it. Your life is not nailed to your spine as my peoples are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PULL OUT, revealing that Remo arms are spread-eagle, attached to ropes pulled taught by opposing tree limbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan nudges him with the point of his sword. Remo SCREAM agony, then speaks in his savage, broken dialect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! I know how make you rich! Rich! You hear name Khalar Singh? You have what he want. The girl, yes? Khalar give you anything for her. More!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remo pauses, not wanting to answer. Conan put the blade b to Remo's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could be the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one. The Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan's mind races, remembering Khalar's words from long

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A queen in hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! I sent to find her. Bring her. He wait for me now, at Great Wall. He pay you anything. More! 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I should ransom her to your master? Not exactly loyal -- but still, a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan pulls out a sheet of handwritten paper from Remo's tunic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll help me deliver it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torchlight dots the heights of a fifty-foot high stone wa erected between giant rock formations, an impassable barr that runs countless miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wreckage of old siege equipment dots the hillside bef the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aging catapult looks down upon the wall below. Slowly, begins to turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan pushes the catapult until it aims towards the Great Wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear MUFFLED SCREAMS, and find Remo tied to a boulder cradled in the catapult. Conan pulls the gag out of Remo' mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please! Please! I help you! I do anything you wish!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan stuffs a parchment in his mouth. He takes out his s and cuts another NOTCH into his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He then cuts the rope and WHOOSH! The catapult fires toss Remo and the rock he's tied to high into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Patrolling SOLDIERS are crushed beneath the massive rock as it reduces a section of wall to rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stares down at Remo's broken body. Ukafa and Fariq stand beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brought a message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukafa hands him the bloodied parchment. Khalar reads it.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gold, for the girl. A ransom, for me to deliver in person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll find them -- and come back with their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let the girl escape once, Ukafa. What makes you think you can do better now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the monastery. It was my understanding that you were in charge of its capture --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukafa's anger grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! We will take no chances. We will pay this thief what he wants, and more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan returns from the nearby hills, carrying a pair of rabbits he's hunted and skinned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around, surprised not to find Tamara. He hears a yelp from nearby and walks to a dirt path beyond the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
