dialogues.text: She's tied up and gagged and she's wormed her way this fa muddying and scraping herself all along the way. She lets a frustrated grunt as Conan simply picks her back up and carries her back to the outcropping. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the gag from her mouth and drops a skinned rabbi her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara squirms away from the carcass, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't you at least cook it first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire draws attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan tears into his rabbit, chewing on the raw meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it bother you, blood on your hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only blood on these hands I claimed with my own sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean hands mean nothing. Kings and Queens claim more lives than I will ever meet, and not a drop is spilled in their presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I've done no harm to you. I've done no harm to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan confronts her, enraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie. You are the very reason my people are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you mad? I never met your people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Khalar Singh has. He destroyed my people, looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Tamara understands. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one who came for us? His name is Khalar Singh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did not know who sought us, only that we were sought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hid from him. And while you did, others died in your place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we did not hide, countless more would have been killed! You do not know what purpose he has for our queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I do not care, for he will not live to see it bear fruit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- you seek to kill this Khalar? We have the same aim. He takes my queen to Khor Kalba. I have sworn an oath to protect her. I can help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough lies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan puts the gag back in her mouth and binds her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan watches the Great Wall silently, absently playing w a DAGGER in his hand as he gauges the many guardposts alo the wall. The archers. The barrels of oil. The cavalry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels eyes upon him and looks down at Tamara, still bo and gagged, her eyes burning holes in his forehead. Conan pulls out her gag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will keep quiet. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What use is talking? You won't believe a word I speak. I only want to know this -- how will you kill Khalar? You are too big to play the assassin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will be the lure that will draw me close. Then I will scale the wall and cut him down where he stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the archers and cavalry? They will be napping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They will not be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Not good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan is shocked by her brazen response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should you fail, I'll be left without a weapon, helpless in my enemies hands. Let me help, Conan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan responds by putting the gag back in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But still Tamara glares at him -- and we can see the hint Conan's resolve bending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh stands atop the wall, awaiting Conan. Fariq draws close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me take care of this thief, father. He's beneath your notice. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed Remo, likely his cavalry legion as well. Whatever he is, he is more than a mere thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, off in the distance, at the far edge of the desert clearing, two figures step out from amongst the boulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan holds a squirming, but bound Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be still!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan thrusts Tamara in Khalar's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling to Khalar) I have what you want! Where's my gold?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar reaches down and lifts a heavy sack of gold coins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Triple your price. Come and claim it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gates open and Khalar strides out into the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stand a hundred feet ahead.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Send her to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh throws the gold sack. It lands halfway betwe them. He sends Tamara ahead, her mouth gagged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the moment Tamara reaches the gold --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out underneath the sand, FOUR HORSEMEN rise up out o the desert floor. They each bear weighted nets and spiked lances, and they surround Conan. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rider gallops towards Conan who simply LOPS OFF HORSES FRONT LEGS. As the beast collapses, Conan crushes rider's skull with his broadsword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next two riders attack together, but Conan dodges the nets and rips away one of their spears, only to lodge it the other rider's chest. He dives at and tackles the firs rider, TOPPLING HIM, ALONG WITH HIS HORSE. He snaps the second rider's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last rider comes at Conan, who horizontally slashes R THROUGH THE HORSE'S NECK AND THEN THE RIDER'S NECK. Both human and animal head tumble to the desert floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four riders are dead, in a matter of seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles. He's got Tamara by the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fast. But are you fast enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan's eyes go to the top of the wall, where CHEREN and archer prepare to fire. Conan rushes forward as the flami arrows stream toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXPLOSIONS rip through the air where Conan was, throwing huge dust cloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan bursts out of the dust cloud, lunging in an attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Khalar Singh is not there. He has withdrawn inside th gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baring his teeth, Conan runs at the wall itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheren and the archers let loose another volley at Conan, evades and strikes away the falling arrows with his sword

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explosions fill the air, but none of them scorch Conan as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan hits the base of the wall at full stride, like a mountain lion. Reaching out, he launches himself up, taki half the vertical of the wall in a single leap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Digging his hand into the seam of the wooden beams, he st only to vault up again, taking the forty foot wall in two upward bounds. 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan leaps upon wall walk, the passageway atop the Great Wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tries to hide his surprise. Even as he draws his sword, C takes out the four SOLDIERS in his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have run, while you could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan looks at the sword. It strikes a chord in him. IT I THE SWORD HIS FATHER FORGED! Enraged, Conan charges the slight Fariq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq partially parries the attack. He's obviously well- trained, but he's no match for Conan. The tip of Conan' b cuts a large gash in Fariq's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh arrives, grabbing his son by his collar and flinging him away from the barbarian. Fariq struggles to stand, trying in vain to hide his embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan and Khalar Singh size each other up on the narrow w walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering what it would take for you to stop cowering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't cowering. I was studying. You're quite gifted with a sword, but it's not from schooling. Your speed and power makes up for a lack of -- finesse. I've seen such fighting before -- Cimmerian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, Conan charges Khalar Singh. He swings down on Kh Singh's head, only when the sword reaches it, it finds nothing but air. Khalar is fast.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cimmerian it is. Now it makes sense. You came for blood, not gold. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan responds by lunging in, swinging his broadsword in broad arc, with all his might. Even in the small space, Khalar's lateral speed is dizzying. He sidesteps Conan's attack and backhands Conan's face with the flat of his tulwar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan's resolve wavers momentarily, knowing Khalar could just as easily sliced his throat.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your people barely afforded me a challenge. You're little more than beasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan comes at Khalar with twice as much fury, smashing entire posts as he hacks at the warlord, who simply evade the attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the wall walk they move, Conan attacking while Khala seems complacent enough just to defend.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've come a long way, barbarian, only to fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar ducks Conan's last wild swing and gashes Conan twi both deeply in his midsection. Khalar then KICKS Conan, sending the Cimmerian slamming onto the rock parapet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRUNCH. Conan lands directly on his back, his sword clattering away from him. Khalar's men back away into a circle. Conan struggles to get on all fours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar KICKS Conan in his shattered chest, lifting Conan the ground with his might. He follows up with a devastati punch to Conan's face, one which lands like a piledriver. CRUNCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan can only bleed as Khalar looms over him.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So much for vengeance. (to his soldiers) Get me oil -- and a torch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers quickly bring over a bucket of oil and a lit tor

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that really the best you could do? Is that as far as you could think ahead? Just rush in and kill me? 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Khalar Singh, Conan spots Tamara being brought up, hands bound. Her eyes show an intense fear, but resolve a well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between the bonds she slips down a blade. It's CONAN'S DAGGER. She quickly cuts her bonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all the attention focused on Conan, no one is quick enough to stop her as GRABS THE TORCH FROM THE SOLDIER, LIGHTING THE ARROWS IN CHEREN'S QUIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheren spins around, sees the flames reaching his pitched arrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's far too late. Tamara hits the floor, beside Cona BOOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blast sends parts of Cheren flying in every direction Ukafa, Fariq, and the wall guards are flattened by the concussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh, who was standing closer to the explosion, i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warlord slowly rises, his head pounding from the explosion. He looks up. The entire parapet is on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grits his teeth and climbs the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thick wall of flame rages before Khalar. Conan and Tama are gone. He looks over the far side of the wall, where t figures on horseback ride off into the distance, Tamara holding Conan atop the horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukafa and Fariq rise and see what Khalar Singh sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukafa, you will take half our forces North, to the Sea. I will take the rest South.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What of me, father? 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will return to Khor Kalba. You will feed the women to the beast until you find our Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not. I will track the barbarian with you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, Khalar Singh grabs him by the back of his head, pulling him in close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I care what you wish?! You want to play warrior? It is not in you. One day you will be king, but warlord, never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can. Let me prove it to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not risk your life again. You are my line, my successor. You will not throw away all that I have worked for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smile creeps up on Ukafa's face, watching Fariq's embarrassment. He withdraws hastily, all eyes on him.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (without looking at Ukafa) If I find you smiling before you bring me the girl, I will take every tooth I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukafa buries the smile as Khalar turns to the wall of fla left in Conan's wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flames become the blaze of the forge.

dialogues.speaker: CORIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: More wood boy! We must test the steel with our fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan, a young boy again, kneels beside the woodpile, pul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when he hands them to his father, he notices his fath is covered with sword wounds, cut and bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for? The fire is dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan turns back to the wood pile. Instead of wood, the p is full of the bodies of those he recently killed: Lucius Remo, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young Conan struggles to push the first body onto the forge. Still the fire diminishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan turns and there is no more wood. And no more bodies

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not enough. I've failed you father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will never be enough, Conan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins. Behind him TAMARA stands, a look of sadness on face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through suffering, you will learn your purpose, boy. And you have not begun to suffer yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan's eyes pop open. He inhales sharply, gripped by the dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is dark, surrounded by thick draperies. Conan li on a straw bed with white sheets, soaked through with his sweat. He looks to his wounds, all bandaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises--a bit too fast because he falls back to his bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't move so fast. I bound your wounds as best I could, but I'm no healer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan looks over to discover Tamara sitting nearby. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the Wasp. You told me where it laid, just before you passed out. Though I can't say as I feel much safer here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan's response is to rise again, his face contorting in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't embarrass me with thanks, I only saved your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were -- adequate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan pulls aside one of the thick draperies that surroun his bed. Behind it lies a staircase, which he ascends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan steps out onto the deck of a sixty-foot djunk, traveling quickly down a wide and powerful river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what we have here. A hill ape in over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan spins to see the rough, brightly dressed Zamoran pi ARTUS leaping down from the quarterdeck, his sword out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other ZAMORAN PIRATES draw near as well. Tamara sees scene, suddenly uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just wondering what that smell was. (sniffs near Artus) Now I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take no stowaways. Only paying passengers. You've best be laden with gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's metal you seek, perhaps you'd settle for steel. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a flash Conan's sword lunges forward. CLANG. It meets Artus's, sparking as they collide. Artus LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still fast Artus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast, deadly, charming, rakishly handsome. (to the pirates) All hail Conan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All hail Conan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artus slaps his hand on Conan's back and Conan winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, friend. Looks like you've had a rough road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't get easier. Khalar Singh lives. He'll be coming for me and the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. We're scrapping for a fight these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one may be more than you wish. I need you to get me close to Khor Kalba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artus rubs his beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest up. We'll get you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan withdraws to his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan collapses on the bed as Tamara follows him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We go to Khor Kalba?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan puts a brawny arm over his tired eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave me to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Tamara doesn't leave, forcing Conan to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would risk your life for royalty? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara pauses, realizing she must trust Conan to gain his help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she represent freedom, not just ours but all Hyboria's. What do you know of Acheron?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall tale. Meant to scare children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is no fable. It's my people's history. Acheron was an empire that swallowed all of Hyboria, led by the King and his legion of demon warriors. Unstoppable. Insatiable. Immortal. But still it had one weakness. For the true power of Acheron laid not with its King, but the Queen. Every twenty years, a new queen from the royal line would be coronated with a crown of iron. Spikes would pierce her, slowly drain her precious blood, and through her suffering Acheron would remain invincible. Until one of my ancestors, an Acheronian himself, put a stop to this tyranny. He and others spirited the new Queen away, hiding her from the empire and all those who would raise it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What care I for queens and empires?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan turns to head back to his bed. Tamara grabs him, incensed. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you hear me? This evil faces us all. All of civilization will fall if the army of Acheron is raised again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard. Only I would happily put all of your "civilization" to the torch myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- you owe me a debt, you thankless oaf!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My only debt is to my people. And it still lies unpaid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The enormous siege vessel lies before a burning PORT CITY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SAILOR, crying, grovels on his knees before Khalar and men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a pirate ship. They left as soon as the girl and the large one boarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way did they sail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: North.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you certain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please, I'm telling you the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar nods to one of his men, who slits the Sailor's thr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar turns to his FALCONER, with the huge bird of prey his arm. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send word to Ukafa. They come to him by sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Falconer nods and heads off. Khalar looks to his soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Find me a warship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship sails like a ghost over black water, the stars l up impossibly bright. Artus finds Tamara sitting near the bow. He hands her a steaming bowl of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to taste it going down would be my advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've known Conan long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sailed with him for a while. I would like to say I know the man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is a riddle to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, he's that too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have the same goal. Why will he not trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would he? He's a stranger in every land he trods. A man with no home, no people, none but the company of ghosts. And he bears the weight of their deaths every moment of every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is no way to live. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't live. I've seen in him great mirth, only to watch it smothered by greater melancholy. He owes a blood debt, and he can entertain no other joy, no other cause, until it is fulfilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yet you call him friend, and risk death to help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something of Conan. He will never lie. He will never break a trust, once given. And he will never, ever give up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a stubborn ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artus LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is that, lass. He is that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AKHUN and his Turanian slavers lead the female monks into large circular chamber, lit by many torches. Before them a PIT, dark and foreboding, with a bamboo grid placed ato it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq enters, an AIDE holding the iron box he used earlie Fariq has a bandage on his face where Conan struck him, a he looks even more angry and malevolent than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we stand again. Will the queen reveal herself, or must another innocent suffer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq walks past the row of women, each recoiling. He sla one. Then another, his rage only building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father, he tires of your charade. He grows impatient. But I have no such haste. I enjoy watching you squirm. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq passes Ilira, slowing his pace. He closes in on the YOUNGEST FEMALE MONK, a true innocent with terrified eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'd like to see the end your sisters faced back at the monastery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq slowly opens the box before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness of the box slithers a grotesque TENTACLE. tentacle is severed, but still alive, thirsting for blood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrified as she is, the young monk says nothing. Fariq closes the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Your fear is not enough yet? Let's try harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq nods to the slavers, who unchain her from the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read all there is to know of mighty Acheron. Why would true Acheronians protect a traitor to their own? You once held the entire world in your grasp, now you hide and cower like pitiful mice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes the girl. She falls to the grid, the sound echo down into the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN INHUMAN GROWL emits from the darkness. Something comes The girl looks below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And mice are meant to be swallowed whole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a MASSIVE TENTACLE, ten times the size of the o in the box, comes hurtling up through the grid. It grabs young monk, its barbs ripping into her, dragging her into darkness below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her SCREAMS echo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was in the box could only drink from you one at a time. But the beast of Acheron, it will claim four of you this night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who will spare the rest and tell me which of you is the queen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a single woman moves, resolved. Ilira catches herself but also stays silent. She looks up to see Fariq staring her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her pupils widen in fear as Fariq's cold stare bores into her.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I am here, swine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq turns -- only it is another FEMALE MONK that glares him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am the one you seek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last. Some bravery. But of course, you wouldn't expect me to take your word, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Fariq reaches for her--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara awakens with a SCREAM, her body resting against th curved hull of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara looks around with a panicked look, until she reali where she is.

dialogues.speaker: CONAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I hope I awoke with less clamor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their roles reversed, now it is Tamara's turn to see Cona sitting nearby, drinking from a flask of mead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're drinking? You were near death this time yesterday. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a better reason to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara actually manages to LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think--I could try some of that? I'm curious of its taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never tasted mead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara shrugs, embarrassed. Conan hands her flask. She ta a deep swallow, some spilling out over her cheeks. But sh doesn't cough, and smiles brightly afterwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan reaches for the flask, but Tamara ignores him, taki another swig. It quickly loosens her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something. Once you've killed Khalar and claimed your vengeance, then what? You will be free from your ghosts. What of your future, Conan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no future. It died with my people, as I should have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So your life is penance? For what, for living? And when you too die, what do you believe happens then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan just shrugs, taking back the mead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara, her tongue loosened by drink, laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing? I couldn't live without some kind of belief in the world after this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe in the cold of steel, the warmth of flesh. All else is fairy tales. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps. But I still die with faith in my heart, belief in something greater than one's self. What will you die with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Purpose. I die with purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara steps out onto the deck, grabbing her pounding hea Her first hangover. She hears a THUMPING sound, followed ANOTHER, and walks towards the side of the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara looks overboard, to the water below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RIVER IS FILLED WITH BODIES! Bloated, they float in b red water as flies buzz around them. One of them hits the hull of the boat. THUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara blinks, unsure if the vision is real -- but then s joined by other PIRATES who gape at the bodies below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To stations! To stations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara turns and up ahead spies --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The larger warship cuts through the water, manned by a le of rowers. On the deck of the warship, UKAFA and his SPEA stand. The SAILORS get the most out of the billowing blac sails. The ship gains fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan exits his room, sees the danger. Artus appears at h side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? They have us outnumbered, but we might beat their speed. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is what they wish. They drive us to another force, approaching from the south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We give them what they think they want. (to the Pirates) About ship! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pirates leap into action, tacking and turning the gal with great speed and efficiency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukafa smiles, his gold teeth shining. The ship's CAPTAIN stands beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're turning to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. We only need stay close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is turned around now, fleeing. ARCHERS from the Warship f arrows that barely reach the Galley. The Pirates dodge th few that land on deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara reaches Conan and Artus. She's worried to say the least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us show them why she is called the Wasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artus smiles. He was hoping Conan would say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is she called the Wasp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open astern! Load the stinger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pirates rush to the back of the ship. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain stares ahead, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are doing -- something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, the stern of the ship begins to part, reveal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mounted with a barbed harpoon, fifteen feet long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fire the weapon. The harpoon races for the bow of th Warship, a thick rope trailing it. It smashes into the wo ripping through it like it was paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rip her apart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pirates grab the heavy rope and run, pulling the rope and the harpoon back towards the Wasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it's pulled out, the barbs of the harpoon rip a wider in the warship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain and crew are in a panic. Men rush to patch th gaping hole in the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're taking on water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to port!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Let them fire again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukafa guts the captain with his spear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be it. (to his spearmen) Get below. Be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pirates load the harpoon in the crossbow device a sec time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It fires, smashing again into the wooden hull of the Wars

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The harpoon lodges deep inside the hull -- where Ukafa an his spearmen wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rush forward and grab onto the harpoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring her back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, the pirates pull the harpoon back out. It falls in the water as they pull on the rope tied to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do not notice Ukafa and his dozen spearmen clasping very same rope as its pulled toward the Galley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artus looks at the Warship. It's foundering and sinking quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead in the water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHEER goes up among the pirates --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then one PIRATE takes a spear through the chest. All turn to the side of the Wasp, where Ukafa and his men cli aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan's eyes alight with fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I was growing weary with boredom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan motions to a pair of pirates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hide her below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Spearmen rush to the attack. The pirates spring to th defense of the ship, countering the Spearmen with cutlass dagger. Ukafa marshals his men as a fierce battle rages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Spearmen quickly make their way to the interior of th galley, throwing the dead bodies of the pirates overboard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan grabs the nearby jib, swings over, and plants both in the face of one of the spearmen, knocking him over the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sea captain proves dangerous in his own right, grabbi the head of one of the Spearmen and violently pulling it to the gunwale of the ship, impaling the Spearman's eye o handspike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive warrior shows incredible speed as well, dodgi one cutlass attack only to turn the weapon upon another pirate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cimmerian cuts through a Spearman, his gaze focused o Ukafa. Ukafa stares right back as he runs through a pair pirates. Finally, the two warriors stand only feet apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two warriors eye each other with satisfaction. Ukafa' frightening, sharpened gold teeth shine as he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are each the last of our tribe, Cimmerian. Yours dies this day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan responds by lunging forward, swinging his sword in broad arc. Ukafa is just as quick, stepping back and allo his spear to block the swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukafa whirls the war spear in great circles, forcing Cona parry, stepping back beyond the spear's reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two powerful warriors trade blows back and forth, nei able to gain the advantage. 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your head will top my spear today, but know Khalar's pig son will soon share your fate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukafa tries to spear Conan through the chest, and Conan decides to drop his sword, grabbing the spear as it passe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan then pulls on the spear, throwing Ukafa off his balance, towards Conan. Conan then kicks the warrior in t chest, hurtling Ukafa backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Conan turns the spear on its master. Ukafa, unarmed, forced to backpedal as Conan thrusts the spear at him. A of close misses leaves Ukafa with gashes on his chest and arm, but he manages to knock the spear from Conan's hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battle goes to hand-to-hand. It's primal, each of the covered in blood. Ukafa bear hugs Conan, then resorts to using his teeth to bite into Conan's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan YELLS IN PAIN, butting Ukafa's head and knocking hi back. Conan falls to the stern of the ship, his back agai the harpoon crossbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ukafa shakes off the head butt, and sees his spear nearby picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now finally, you die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises up to hurl the spear through Conan, only to see Conan manning the harpoon, NOW TURNED TO FACE UKAFA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crossbow fires and the harpoon punches a massive hole through Ukafa, its momentum throwing him off the galley, the sea beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hides inside a small compartment of the ship. She hea FOOTSTEPS walking past, then returning. An ARM suddenly reaches in and grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she's pulled out, Tamara SCREAMS right in Conan's face doesn't even flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The battle ended, the pirates toss the dead Spearmen into sea and prepare to make sail again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Conan lashes his sword to his back, standing b the gunwales with Tamara and Artus, a SMALL DINGHY waitin below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could get you closer. Another half day along the coast --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you head west, to draw off our pursuers. I'll find another path to Khor Kalba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So be it. Swift wind at your backs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan rows away from the galley with powerful strokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you are taking me with you to Khor Kalba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said that. But I won't leave a virgin onboard a pirate ship, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- but -- who said I was a virgin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan just shakes his head as a parting fog reveals a lar Colossus head, the fallen remains of an enormous statue, lying agape on the shoreline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan pulls off his jerkin, revealing a torso rippling wi muscles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll rest here until morning. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I awake alone? Do you intend to leave me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would do you a kindness. Khor Kalba will bring only death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Conan. Artus told me of how you lost your tribe. I too had to watch as my people were taken from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan ignores her, gathering wood for a fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I ask is that you let me travel with you. I too have a purpose. I must get to the queen. I would rather you kill me here, than fail her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan continues collecting, infuriating Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong about you. You are no fearless warrior. Your heart is closed to all but fear -- and hate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan draws flint, starting the fire. Only once his task complete does he answer Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We leave at dawn. I will not break stride for you. Not once. I will get you into Khor Kalba. Beyond that I have my purpose, and you yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara offers a thankful nod, her anger subsiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice fire. Does it mean you'll actually cook the meat this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar looks at the destruction of Ukafa's warship, the bodies filling the water. Khalar spots Ukafa's dead body floating there, harpoon still lodged in his chest. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's CAPTAIN approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pirate ship sailed to the west. Even under full sail it'll be no easy task to overtake her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, a FALCON approaches. The Falconer retrieves it parchment tied to its talon. He passes it on to Khalar Si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh reads it, a smile creeping upon his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq has done well. (to the Captain) Head east, back to Khor Kalba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But our chase points the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chase is over. They come to me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara watches Conan from a distance. He silently stalks with nothing more than a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its ears listen intently, aware. Suddenly, it bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is just as quick, racing through the forest on a intercep course with the great beast. He leaps over a fallen log, throwing his dagger with a sweep of his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boar goes down, the blade through its jugular. Conan walks up to the struggling beast, showing no satisfaction he mercifully SNAPS its neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great haunches of the beast roast over the fire. Cona turns the meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, Tamara approaches. She has cleaned herself up her white robe translucent in light of the fire, her wet glistening. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan can't help but notice her supple skin, her curves. stops chewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara notices. Embarrassed, she turns so that he can onl see her side. Conan returns to his food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were the women of your tribe like, Conan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fought beside the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they were equals. And your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She died in battle, even as I was born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you never knew her. It was the same with me. I've always known being a mother was somehow not my fate. But--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara falters, unsure. But Conan's quiet eases her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said earlier Khor Kalba will bring only death. Were you trying to scare me, or do you really believe our end lies there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara nods, having heard as much about Conan. She turns to face him, no longer hiding her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we don't have much time. Your mother perished too young, but at least she died having known the touch of one who cared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara steps closer to Conan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- do you care, Conan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan rises to her, his broad form looming over her sligh build. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Conan shows surprising gentleness as he removes her r and pulls her naked body into his, their mouths meeting i desperate kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan lies atop Tamara by the fire, their sinewy limbs intertwined, fingers locked together. He thrusts into her causing her face to contort in pleasure and pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire grows brighter as Tamara rolls on top, undulatin their pace quickens. Tamara CRIES OUT in ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara stares into the fire, her body wrapped around Cona She gently caresses the notched scars cut into his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've only ever heard you speak of what you'd die for, Conan. What would you live for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan, his eyes closed, keeps them shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever tire of talking? Let me rest, woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara reaches down between Conan's legs. His eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that may work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan growls and pulls himself atop Tamara. Looking down her face, her hair loose and wild, she's beautiful in the soft glow of the firelight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you clearly now, finally, after all this time. (she kisses him deeply) I would be that which you live for, Conan, if you would have me. You may have faith in nothing, Conan -- but I have faith in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan lowers himself back down upon her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan powers his way to the top of a high ridge, spotting down in the vista below:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surrounded on three sides by the coastline, the stone fortress of Khalar Singh rests on a plateau, overlooking bustling, tented city below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan spots a long CARAVAN of packed camels working their towards town, driven by DESERT TRADERS from Shem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll slip in, along with those traders. But you'll need a change of clothes, those monks' robes will draw attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara looks down at her loose-fitting robes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will I wear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caravan rides up to the walled entrance to the city, guarded by Khalar's troops. Blended in amongst the others Conan now wears the elaborate head scarf and clothes of Shemish traders, obscuring all but his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is dressed like a Shemish serving girl, her taut b barely covered by silken drapings. She glares at Conan, miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand why I couldn't be dressed as you are. I look like a whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what better disguise for a monk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan tugs on the rope for the camel to move faster. The Camel BRAYS and rears. Conan yanks harder and the camel f forward, its eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan meets its eye. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not test me, beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there not a living thing you can be at peace with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride into the city, past the troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan and Tamara walk through the town's teeming market, otherworldly bazaar replete with animal sacrifices, veile faces and not a hint of morality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE, his form hidden beneath a cloak, spots Conan an Tamara as they enter, and begins to follow them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city ends at the sheer cliff wall at the bottom of th plateau. There stands a WOODEN PLATFORM that is lowered b massive winch, unloading a cavalry regiment and then rais back up to the fortress above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's probably only way into Khalar's fortress. I'm sure it is heavily guarded at all times, day and night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we must try to scale the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And dodge arrows as we do so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan motions up to the winch. Standing beside it are a h dozen of the four-armed ARCHERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the day, we'd easily be spotted on the climb. And it would be useless to even attempt at night. No, we must find another way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Conan continues around the base of the mesa, the Figur following Conan is joined by TWO OTHERS. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan and Tamara reach a less crowded area of the village when a VOICE rings out behind them.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan spins, sword at the ready. From out of the shadows comes a pair of MEN, their beady eyes fixed on Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thieves. You'll regret finding me.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I think not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of the shadows steps the ONE-EYED THIEF, the sam one who Conan saved from Lucius' beatings. He smiles at Conan, lifting a KEY from a rope around his neck

dialogues.speaker: ONE EYED THIEF
dialogues.text: It took longer than you think to cut this out of Lucius' stomach. After all that work, I figured I'd keep it -- for old times' sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rundown hall, built beneath the city. Wooden supports h up the buildings of the entire city block overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And within the hall, a gathering of THIEVES and ROGUES. They're a flinty collection, many of them missing fingers even hands, evidence of Khalar's cruel justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eat and drink, sharing tales and tips, WENCHES and SERVING WOMEN their cautious eyes following the Cimmerian outsider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The One Eyed Thief takes them to an open table, and immediately three of the serving women descend upon Conan caressing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara watches this, jaw dropped, and manages a COUGH, ev as a SERVING GIRL delivers mead to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan just smiles as he enjoys the silky bodies of the nu women, their breasts practically framing his face. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Do you wish to join in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan cleans mead from his face, scowling at Tamara, as t One-Eyed Thief uses the tabletop to explain the fortress.

dialogues.speaker: ONE EYED THIEF
dialogues.text: --so you were right about the platform. You'll be long dead before you make it top. Same with scaling the cliff. There's no known way to break into the fortress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it?

dialogues.speaker: ONE EYED THIEF
dialogues.text: I didn't say that. I just said there's no known way in -- because no one has ever tried to. But breaking out -- that's another story. It's not much easier, but it's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The One Eyed Thief offers the same gap-toothed grin.

dialogues.speaker: ONE EYED THIEF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You just need to find someone crazy enough to show you the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is the last to follow Conan, the One Eyed Thief an the three THIEVES from before down a short ladder. Below a darkened catacomb, lit only by their torches.

dialogues.speaker: ONE EYED THIEF
dialogues.text: These catacombs run underneath the entire city, even to the cistern that drains out from the fortress dungeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara's foot drops into knee high water. She immediately grabs her nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catacombs? You mean sewers.

dialogues.speaker: ONE EYED THIEF
dialogues.text: Piss and shit are the last things you need to worry about down here. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara eyes the muddy water, nothing visible beneath its murky surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group wades through the water, single file. Conan not HIEROGLYPHICS and carvings on the wall of the catacomb. Massive creatures of the sea, dark sorcery, ritual sacrif

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warning. These catacombs are connected to the sea. It says that the beasts of Acheron protect its secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan presses on, into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The catacomb widens out to a giant circular cistern, its walls rising up high into the darkness. As the torches br light to the space, we see HUNDREDS OF DEAD, ROTTING BODI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Conan and Tamara walk forward, the One Eyed Thief and other stop at the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: ONE EYED THIEF
dialogues.text: Sorry, friend. We stop here. We've heard too much about what lies within to go any further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan simply nods and the thieves depart. Conan raises hi torch, illuminating the near wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around. Up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan heads off one direction, leaving Tamara to navigate other half. Her torch illuminates the grizzly path ahead. inhales deeply and takes her first step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following the slick wall, he passes many DEAD BODIES, but only one catches his eye. He stops before it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing more than a skeleton, picked clean by the rats. B he still bears his leather armor, and a horned helmet tha resembles his father's own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan takes the helmet and places it on his head. It fits perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara is gingerly making her way through the knee high sewage water and the dead bodies submerged within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara leaps up, swinging the torch down towards the wate Conan, nearby, unsheathes his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something touched me. Something slimy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan walks over, the torchlight revealing something on Tamara's leg. It's a SLUG, which he flicks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crom! Stop wasting time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when Conan steps forward, something ROILS THE WATER r before him. He spots a HUGE TENTACLE just before its submerges back into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crom indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Tamara SCREAMS as another tentacle rises up from the water, wrapping around her waist. Tamara grabs hold of th wall as the tentacle tries to pull her underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan immediately SLASHES the tentacle, pulling Tamara aw The squirming decapitated tentacle squirts black blood everywhere, the knee high water seems to come alive with roiling intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan spins, finding a circular stone staircase tiled int the far cistern wall. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they work their way up the circular stairwell, towards thin shaft of firelight up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carved out of solid black rock, both sides of the broad corridor are occasionally punctuated by thick steel doors leading to prison cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan and Tamara emerge from a sewer drain, pushing their to the floor of the hallway. The heavy darkness presses i Conan's torch like a sentient, animate thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor of the corridor is lined with DEAD BODIES, in varying states of decay. There are buckets, filled with entrails and feces, upended. Tamara put her hand over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan continues down the hallway. He and Tamara begin to the sound of EERIE CHANTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, the torch-lined dungeon plunges into darkness a the torches end. Conan holds up his own torch, struggling peer into the black void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan takes a step forward when suddenly a POWERFUL WIND blows out his torch. A moment later, there's the sound of GATE WHISTLING DOWN AND CRASHING INTO THE GROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, comes a DEEP, EARTHY CHUCKLE.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOST OF OIL LIGHTS SUDDENLY COME UP, revealing that the gate that closed behind them was actually just a door to vast CAGE built around a massive PIT. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same pit where Fariq sacrificed the female monk, only now, a half dozen COMBATANTS stand on the grid above the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging high above the pit, in baskets, lie other PRISONE including Tamara's fellow female monks. Several of them Y out Tamara's name as they see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And watching everything, from an amphitheater above the c is the massive Akhun and several of his slavers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which ever one of you slaves gets me the girl, lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Combatants all close in on Conan and Tamara, each tak a different plank way to get to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay behind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara steps behind Conan, who blocks the others' path to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who dies first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first two COMBATANTS attack as one, the first wieldin short sword, the other a pike. The pikeman thrusts first, Conan deftly stepping aside, then pulling the pike, sendi the wielder off balance and into the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoner with the short sword doesn't fare much bette as Conan evades his swipe and decapitates him with a sing blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara sees that the prisoner baskets are suspended by th top half of the metallic cage. She begins scaling the cag her eyes set upon the imprisoned monks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three more COMBATANTS step in to replace the fallen duo. Conan readies himself as the first one steps up, only to the combatant suddenly grabbed by a ENORMOUS TENTACLE, mu like the one Conan cut through earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up from the darkness of the pit comes a gargantuan monste gigantic octopus-like behemoth, with multiple tentacles t feed a pulsing black orifice lined with razor sharp teeth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature reaches out and grabs another SCREAMING combatants, lowering him to its mouth and devouring him i its gnashing maw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature reaches for Conan, who ducks underneath the tentacle, the slices it off. He immediately turns back to check on Tamara -- and he discovers she's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up to see Tamara scaling the cage, now nearly fi feet directly above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive warrior spots Tamara getting close to the prisoner baskets and motions to his two Jailers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's reached the base of the chain supporting one of the baskets when she spots the two Jailers closing in, climbi towards her from either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotting Tamara overhead, Conan tries to keep beneath her evading the swarming tentacles while balancing on the ric planks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's scaling down the basket supporting chain when the f Jailer reaches out to grab her. She reacts by GASHING his eyes, and as he instinctively grabs them, he FALLS TOWARD THE PIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan barely dives out of the way as the fallen Jailer SMASHES through the plank he was on, forcing Conan to jum another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then another COMBATANT comes swinging for the Cimmer forcing him to defend while still not balanced. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next Jailer grabs her, pulling her off the cage. He struggles to pull towards a nearby exit hatch when she BI HIS EAR OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jailer drops Tamara, who SCREAMS as she falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan spots Tamara plunging towards him. In one swift mov he SLASHES his opponent, ducks underneath a writhing tentacle, and reaches out to GRAB TAMARA BY THE ARM AS SH FALLS. His shoulder nearly pops out, but he manages to ho onto Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swings above the chasm, the gnashing teeth of the mon below her. Only a single splintering plank holds her and Conan aloft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a grunt, he swings Tamara and throws her to safety, the edge of the pit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as he gets to his feet, he spots the massive Akhun entering the arena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The giant warrior grins as he boards the same plank as Co He thrusts his thunderous legs down, causing the plank to bend and warp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan struggle to balance on the undulating plank, but hi training in Cimmeria serves him well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Akhun smiles and step closer, again thrusting down with h legs. Conan's balance is thrown, but there's no other pla close enough for him to jump to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll make a nice meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Akhun steps down on the plank one last time, but this tim Conan uses the momentum to SPRINGBOARD UP INTO AIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan soars into the air, his cat-like reflexes keeping h focused as he lands right before the stunned Akhun. With great slash of his blade, Conan eviscerates Akhun. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Akhun's innards drop out of his belly as he falls into th abyss, only to be snapped up by the massive beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan lowers down the last of the baskets. Tamara use a s to smash open the lock, freeing the prisoners inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara shares hugs of joy with the other monks of her flo The women look worn, but unbroken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Ilira?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was taken away by Fariq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the stronger looking women, an ELDER MONK, steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She was just taken this morning. It's not yet midnight, and Khalar still must bring her to the cave of Acheron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara nods and the women begin to ARM THEMSELVES. Conan shakes his head at the rag-tag group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to fight Khalar's troops? Just you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elder Monk grabs and nearby pike and twirls it expert about her body, clearly well versed in it use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cimmerians aren't the only women who know how to fight. And to kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara looks at the other monks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our duty was to keep the queen safe. We failed. But if Khalar brings her to Acheron, it will rise again -- and all our peoples' sacrifice is for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if the queen is not free by the stroke of midnight -- she must be already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other monks nod and they start to head off. Tamara is last to head off, her eyes burning into Conan's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want my help again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You kept your word, I'll keep mine. I pray you fulfill your debt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara kisses Conan's cheek one last time and heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monk travel in single file, the Elder Monk leading th way. Suddenly, she stops, motioning to an entranceway ahe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kill him. We need to find out which way Ilira was taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Elder Monk nods and slips up ahead. We hear a SMASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stunned GUARD lies before the assembled monks. Tamara glares down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us where the last girl was taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard just LAUGHS at them through bloody teeth.

dialogues.speaker: CONAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Let me ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard's face drops as Conan steps out from the darkne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your debt -- 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will be where your queen is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara smiles. She knows it is a half truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Conan and the monks enter, the throne room is empty, scattered light barely illuminating the expansive chamber

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilira sits on the throne, crown on her slumped head. Tama runs over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ilira!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises Ilira's head, only to discover lifeless eyes. Tamara cradles her best friend's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dead. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the monks can react, ARROWS STREAK OUT FROM THE DARKNESS, killing them all. Only Conan is quick enough to dodge his arrow by diving aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he comes up, Khalar has Tamara, his sword at her nec Several ARCHERS stand behind him, at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only begun. Because that one was not the heir to Acheron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar smiles down at Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, what he's saying dawns on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It can't be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secretive, the traitors of Acheron. It wasn't easy, but Fariq finally wrung honesty from the girl. That poor innocent was forced to live a lie, even as the truth was kept from the queen herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you did the rest, barbarian. My thanks for delivering the Queen to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a trap door opens beneath Conan and drops down the darkness, landing with a heavy THUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan awakens to the familiar sound of a hot blade SIZZLI as it hits the cooling vat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is no dream of his father's forge -- as he looks to see Fariq holding a sword, its tip still red hot, the flames of the fortress's forge behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan's thrusts forward, only to find his armed chained around a heavy mortar and stone pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq strokes his newly acquired scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last you awaken, Cimmerian. It's been hours you've made me wait for my fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan says nothing, but his eyes scan the room, taking in everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made me lose face in front of my father. That wasn't wise. But what should I expect from a Cimmerian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swift end!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan strains at the chain, ripping the skin beneath his shackles -- but a thin wisp of mortar comes loose from th pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hardly. But that is a difference between you and me. A swift end would be a mercy I do not intend to grant. No, you must suffer for your transgressions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must beg for your suffering to end. Just as your people did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves the glowing sword tip in front of Conan's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie. I was there. My father never uttered a sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq LAUGHS, amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were there? What were you doing, warrior? Watching your father die, without saying a sound? Taking your eyes will be justice indeed, coward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq pushes the hot tip of the sword against Conan's ski Conan's face reddens with pain, but he doesn't utter a so But as Conan pulls on his chains -- more mortar falls. As Fariq turns back to place the sword in the forge, Conan notices one of the bricks the chains are fastened to is LOOSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw my father die. Slain by one who can only kill men already on their knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq turns, his eyes blazing. He glances over at the two GUARDS by the door, who try not to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've killed many in battle, cur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Then why did your father not let you face me before, when I had sword in hand. He thought you unequal to the task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq responds by pushing the red hot blade against Conan chest. Conan just YELLS back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coward! Prove your strength!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Fariq pushes the hot blade against Conan's skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my eyes, coward -- if you can. 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq yells and thrust the tip of the sword at Conan's he Conan lifts his manacles, forcing the blade up into the b holding his chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Conan pulls on the chains with all his might, loosen the heavy brick, which falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one powerful movement, Conan begins SWINGING the chain with the mortar block on the end, a homemade ball and cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Guards come forward, sword drawn, only to meet wi CRUNCHING blow by Conan's weapon. Both their heads get ca in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq rushes Conan, getting in too close for Conan's wide swings. Conan simply meets Fariq's sword with the heavy chains, then encircles Fariq's neck with the steel bonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fariq CHOKES, falling to the ground, gasping for air. But Conan doesn't kill him -- yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vat of molten steel bubbles in a cauldron within the fo Conan uses tongs to lift the cauldron out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan kicks him onto his back. Fariq's last vision is tha Conan, tipping the cauldron, the hot iron descending towa his eyes. Fariq SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan reaches down and picks up Fariq's sword. THE SWORD CONAN'S FATHER MADE FOR HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By torchlight, Khalar Singh leads his black-armored PERSO GUARD, two dozen men strong, across a rocky peninsula, jutting out into the sea. On the back of Khalar's horse, bound, rides the helpless Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they round a large rock spire they spy a fearsome and inspiring sight. A massive SKULL, seemingly a natural roc formation, rises over the peninsula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they ride closer, we can make out one more detail -- t mouth of the skull is actually a massive door, at least s feet high, and seemingly made up of jagged bone. It has t appearance of teeth, completing the skull illusion. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes the full complement of soldiers to open the enor doors. Khalar Singh rides in. Moonlight from the huge eye the skull illuminate terrifying faces in the darkness. Fa of demonic warrior statues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At their feet lie the decaying bones of human skeletons, numerous to count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no empire, only a graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see only with your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar nods to his men. Two Guardsmen take their torches light other torches set in the walls. It sets off a chain reaction. As far as the eye can see torches ignite reveal the true scope of this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous cave, the walls lined with monumental columns that frame countless bas relief carvings of demonic origi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And at the far of the cave, an ALTAR sits beneath a raise THRONE, surrounded by a SACRIFICIAL POOL. The pool is emp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar turns to his guards.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Close the gates and stay here. Send my son to me when he arrives. (motioning to two of them) You two, come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar dismounts at the sacrificial altar, carved of out purple-shaded rock. Around its edges are deep channels, f the blood of its victims. And on its four corners -- shac of bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Acheronians had a wonderful sense of balance, don't you think? For one to ascend to royalty, another must fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the flick of a wrist, Khalar cuts Tamara's bonds. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara head butts him, struggling to escape, but Khalar absorbs the blow effortlessly. He throws Tamara upon the altar, his two guards shackling her in place.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For a hundred generations the kings of Acheron were crowned, and the queens were sacrificed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar snaps his fingers and two guardsmen bring an ornat carved BOX MADE OF BONE, laying it before the altar. Like Chinese puzzle box, Khalar manipulates the carvings of skulls, sacrifices, and creatures until the box UNLATCHES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
