dialogues.text: And from the box he lifts two items. A CROWN OF GOLD and CROWN OF IRON. The crown of gold is magnificent, ornately detailed gold that glows in the firelight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the crown of iron is terrifying. Huge rough spikes ex from it in every direction. It looks more like a weapon t a crown.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What a day for you. This morning you were a handmaiden. Tonight, you are a queen giving birth to an empire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloodied and weary, Conan approaches the Skull Rock. He h nothing more than his sword, his loincloth and a small BU SACK tied to his hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stumbles, falling to his knees. His wounds have taken grave toll. Still he stands and presses on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes on the doors. They do not budge in the least. H puts his shoulder to the doors -- his every muscle strain to their utmost. Again -- no movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan backs away, taking stock of the surroundings. He cl up the side of the rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh CHANTS in Acheronian. Ancient, harsh words, he lifts the two crowns overhead, offering them to the statues of dark gods all around. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. You don't know what you are about to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do. For thirty years I have dreamed of this day. The day our people rise from the ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar Singh continues his chant and places the gold crow upon his head. As he does so, the light from the moon reflects off the crown, bathing the sacrificial pool in a unnatural glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUMP-THUMP. A deep and foreboding sound echoes throughou the cave, shaking everything like an earthquake. It sound like the heartbeat of a giant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar next places the iron crown around Tamara's head. S thrashes and struggles but to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once the crown is around her head -- THUMP-THUMP! The spi around the iron crown grow shorter AS THE SPIKES DRIVE THEMSELVES INTO HER HEAD. She SCREAMS in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood drips from beneath the crown, flowing into channels around the edges of the altar.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It begins. You give birth to an empire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan climbs -- muscles straining -- slipping -- hanging by one hand -- and climbing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUMP-THUMP. The statuary shakes, indeed the whole earth does. Conan nearly slips, but keeps his grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches the eye of the skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the moon over his shoulder, Conan stares down at the unholy sight before him. We pull back revealing Tamara, h blood draining from her body. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara, her face pale from blood loss, begins to pray in pained whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good that you pray. Gods will be here soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara struggles to speak, her body wracked with pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll--be---here--sooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: CONAN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar turns to see the outline of Conan, framed by the moonlight, looking down at Khalar from atop of one the warrior statues. A thick vine dangles nearby, Conan's rou down from the cave roof above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan then leaps down to the skeleton covered floor befor the altar. It is a killing floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Guardsmen leap for him, but Conan dispatches them with a pair of strikes. Both fall down dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan meets Tamara's eyes, a look of determination, assurance. He starts toward the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will say this for you, barbarian. You are hard to kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've faced me before and lost. What do you think has changed now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan lunges for Khalar, their swords meeting with a flas sparks. They fight to a brief standstill when ---THUMP, THUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara writhes in pain as the spikes drive deeper into he head. More blood pours forth. The blood in the channels speeds up and finds the channel leading down to the sacrificial pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan makes another movement toward the altar, but Khalar nimbly blocks his path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are strong, Cimmerian, but we both know you are not my equal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan takes the burlap sack wrapped at his hip pulls it o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you used my father to teach your son a lesson about strength. Now let me teach you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan tosses out what is inside. It falls to the ground, rolling to Khalar Singh's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar looks down at the ground -- at the head of his bel son, his eyes gone, replaced by molten metal. Khalar trem in shock and rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar reaches for the severed head, giving Conan a brief window to rush to Tamara's side. Conan tries to lift her the altar, but the bone shackles still pin her down.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cimmerian!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, Khalar CHARGES Conan throwing all his skill and force into an all-out attack. Conan simply sidesteps it, shatters the bone shackle holding one of Tamara's wrists. Before he can shatter the other, Khalar charges again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar swings, Conan spins, his blade catching Khalar's j inches from his face. Conan throws Khalar off him, knocki the warlord back ten feet. Khalar's attack is feral, uncontrolled. He's lost his balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinning and striking blindly, Conan smashes the second shackle on her wrist. He continues his motion, bringing h sword around to meet Khalar's next strike. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Khalar looks like the enraged amateur, and Conan the polished warrior. Their battle takes them away from the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With her hands free, Tamara struggles to pull the spikes and remove the crown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan repels another Khalar attack, this time striking Khalar's chest and drawing blood. The Guardsmen arrive fr the other side of the cave, drawing their swords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar waves them off, his fury aimed at the Cimmerian.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Queen. Shackle her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In agony, Tamara pulls one of the spikes out, then anothe She pushes with all her might, lifting the crown of iron her bloodied head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the Guardsmen charge her, pin her down, and force th crown back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUMP, THUMP! The crown spikes imbed themselves even deep as Tamara SCREAMS. The blood now fills the channels of th altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FOLLOW the trail of blood, down the side of the altar, a spiral channel around the leg, and in a wide circle aro the altar until reaching the channel's end --

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST DROP OF TAMARA'S BLOOD TOUCHES THE SACRIFICIAL
dialogues.text: POOL. It BOILS instantly, multiplying itself exponentiall bubbling forth and filling the entire pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AND ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE. A massive earthquake jolts the entire cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Khalar Singh and Conan battle, the ground beneath them the wide cave floor CRACKS and SPLINTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUMP-THUMP! The earthquake intensifies and the entire fl of the cave GIVES WAY, tumbling into an incredible abyss. Conan and Khalar alike grab onto the only rocks they can reach to prevent them from falling further. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan ends up against one of the walls on the side of the cave. Khalar clings to the rocks on the edge of the sacre pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their bodies are illuminated by a fiery glow. They look below, searching for the source of the glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another two hundred feet deep lies the golden spired city ancient Acheron. The cave is but a forechamber, the sligh taste of the true glory and horror of Acheron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as they stare down into the ancient city, the shadows there MOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a trick of the light? No. Whatever the dark forms a they are coming this way, climbing the tallest demonic sp and leaping impossibly far to climb up after Conan and Kh Singh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar gazes down at the city with wide eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KHALAR SINGH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Beyond my dreams --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara, her body's blood nearly drained, is still shackle the altar, which now teeters over the edge of chasm, pois to fall into the fiery depths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the abyss, Conan spots her and scale the cave wall, up to a tiered plateau. He moves quickly, trying to get to Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar watches, entranced, as the first of the creatures rises out of the pit. They climb the walls like insects, clinging to the walls, their heads swiveling like a prayi mantis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The look like the statues above -- a hybrid -- part human part demon. Their skin is a perfect black, armor carved o black bone, faces once human but now demonic with blood r eyes and gnashing teeth. 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They advance on Khalar Singh, who is furthest down now th Conan climbs upward towards Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am Khalar Singh, King of Acheron. I command you to kneel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this demonic horde advances right for him, their razo sharp teeth bared. Unsure, Khalar grips his tulwars tight The demonic creatures draw close, and they -- kneel. They climb out of the abyss and immediately lower their heads before Khalar Singh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the corner of his eye, Khalar spots Conan, drawing near.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show him the might of the army of Acheron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they do not rush to follow the order. They stir. One them with more ornate bone armor than the rest looks over Khalar's Guardsmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, we feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its voice is somewhere between a whisper and a hiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Take your fill. I will kill him myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan is on an intercept course with Tamara, leaping acro chasms from statue to statue. Just below him, the first w of Acheronian Warriors reach the Khalar's remaining Guardsmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar's Guardsmen, who have been watching the events wit mouths agape, realize the danger too late. The horde of Acheronian Warriors leaps on them and a massive battle en between the demonic warriors and the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His climbing is dizzying, reminiscent of his youth scalin the cliffs of Cimmeria. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intercepts Conan just below the altar, his tulwars at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your story ends here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two warriors square off, fighting even as they cling the statues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The demon warriors not only slay Khalar's Guardsmen, but their still living bodies apart, dousing themselves in th blood of their victims. It is a violent ritual, both Bacchantic and gruesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Launches himself at Conan, his tulwars sparking off the s statuary. Conan leaps to another statue, parrying the blo Khalar overextends himself, and Conan's sword just barely misses his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar pulls back, tries to settle himself. Conan's eyes narrow, he knows what Khalar is doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a woman, Fariq cried and begged me to spare him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar ROARS in rage, launching an all-out offensive. Con backs up slowly, waiting for his moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it comes quickly. Conan ducks below the tulwars and C Khalar across the stomach. Khalar loses his balance and falls, one hand grabbing a protruding statue arm, danglin over the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan raises his sword to finish the job.

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Conan!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan glances down. The Acheronian Commander drank his fi and now moves to the altar itself, his claw stroking Tama body. With one touch, the shackles open. He and the Acheronian Warriors drag her pale body toward the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar grins up at him through bloody teeth. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take her to a place you can never follow. Who will you fail, Cimmerian? Your father or your woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan leaps down to the altar. The Acheronian Warriors attack. Standing atop the altar, Conan cuts down all come cutting his way through the enemy, working his way to Tam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leap on Conan, impossibly fast. They stab him. They him. But he does not stop. Even wounded, he throws them i the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he reaches Tamara, just before the Commander drags he below. He grabs her arm. The Commander grabs her other ar baring his shark-like teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! Conan punches him in the mouth with his free hand a the Commander falls into the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bloody Conan pulls Tamara up into his arms. Only for Tamara to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan spins just in time as Khalar strikes. Khalar's tulw narrowly misses, and Conan counters. His father's sword r Khalar Singh through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar's body falls into the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the Acheronian Warriors surround them. Thousands clim out of the abyss, teeth bared, closing in on the wounded Conan. Tamara, badly weakened herself, grabs Conan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan, you know what you must do. Kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the only way to end this. My death gives others life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot. 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must. Your parents both understood that purpose. Now it is yours. Live, Conan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear falls from Tamara's face. The demonic warriors pre to strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan drives his sword into Tamara's heart. The crown spi retract and it falls from her head, tumbling into the aby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! A seismic explosion shakes everything, an unearthly GUST OF WIND pulling the Acheronian Warriors back down in the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cave begins to fall, massive sections of the roof dropping in to decimate the pyramid and the city below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan pulls Tamara's body away, even as the world descend into dust and debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalar's HORSE stands near the entrance. Conan puts Tamar body carefully atop the horse, then mounts it himself. He positions her in front of him, his arms encircling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conan gives her lifeless body one last kiss, her blood staining his lips red, as his mother's did as a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blazing sun threatens to explode over the nearby mounta Conan holds a single torch in his hand. His look is hard. Grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pull back to reveal a funeral pyre, Tamara's body atop Conan places the torch to the pyre. It quickly spreads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move in, closer and closer upon Conan's ice blue eyes, blazing fire erupting in them. A fire that will never be extinguished.

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Live, Conan. Live.
